case_vignette: A 25-year-old woman comes to the physician for the evaluation of blindness in her right eye that suddenly started 1 hour ago. She has no feeling of pain, pressure, or sensation of a foreign body in the right eye. She has a history of major depressive disorder treated with fluoxetine. The patient attends college and states that she has had a lot of stress lately due to relationship problems with her partner. She does not smoke or drink alcohol. She does not use illicit drugs. She appears anxious. Her vital signs are within normal limits. Ophthalmologic examination shows a normal-appearing eye with no redness. Slit lamp examination and fundoscopy show no abnormalities. A visual field test shows nonspecific visual field defects. An MRI of the brain shows no abnormalities.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I suddenly lost vision in my right eye about an hour ago.
Have you experienced any pain along with the loss of vision?
No, I have no feeling of pain in my right eye.
Do you have any previous history of eye diseases or surgeries?
No, I do not have any previous history of eye diseases or surgeries.
Are you experiencing any other symptoms like headache, weakness, or numbness?
No, I am not experiencing any other symptoms like headache, weakness, or numbness.
Do you have a history of smoking or any cardiovascular diseases like hypertension or diabetes?
No, I do not smoke and I do not have any cardiovascular diseases like hypertension or diabetes.
Do you have a family history of eye diseases or stroke?
I did not mention any family history of eye diseases or stroke.
Have you noticed any changes in the appearance of your eye, like redness or changes in pupil size?
No, there are no changes in the appearance of my eye; it looks normal with no redness.
Final Diagnosis: Central Retinal Artery Occlusion
